item.description:
Our next discussion will be on Doubt: A History: The Great Doubters and Their Legacy of Innovation from Socrates and Jesus to Thomas Jefferson and Emily Dickinson, by Jennifer Michael Hecht

At the HAC meeting yesterday, due to the amount of information in the book "Doubt," we decided to discuss it in two sessions. At the already scheduled April 18 meeting, we will cover the Introduction and Chapters 1 through 5 (through page 215) and we will discuss the rest of the book at a later meeting. If you have already read beyond page 215, we will be happy to get a preview from you at the April 18 meeting.

Copies of the book are available at public libraries as well as at bookstores and online.

This link will take you to the book at amazon.com:
http://www.amazon.com...

For more information, see http://www.cthumanist...
item.how_to_find_us: We'll most probably be in the library upstairs, or in the social hall.
